text: The National Federation of Energy and Mines (, FNEM) is a trade union representing workers in the energy industry, and coal miners, in France. The union was established on 20 June 2000, when the Miners' Federation merged with the National Federation of Energy and Gas. Like its predecessors, it affiliated to Workers' Force. It was initially led by Gabriel Gaudy. It is based in Paris. ==References== Category:Energy industry trade unions Category:Mining trade unions Category:Trade unions in France Category:Trade unions established in 2000
title: National Federation of Energy and Mines
